newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan money rates close sharply higher.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan money rates close sharply higher.

text.p: Taiwan's money rates finished sharply higher on Wednesday as the central bank failed to inject funds into the banking system to alleviate tightening liquidity, dealers said.
The overnight interbank rate closed at 6.577 percent against Tuesday's 5.986 close, with the 30-day commercial paper jumping to 6.75-7.00 against 5.75.
Cash demand will remain strong ahead of Friday's Lantern Festival, dealers said.
The central bank deputy governor Liang Cheng-chin told reporters on Wednesday the bank has no immediate plan to inject funds, saying it would let market forces determine the short-term money rates.

Trading interest was thin in the bond market over concerns that the central bank may tighten its "stable-to-loose" monetary policy. The 10-year 86/4 bond yield was traded at 6.070-6.075 in earlier session.
